Notes.*: This is shown when the field has no value - so it's only relevant for boolean input fields which have 3 states.

Notes.en-us: Sometimes you're storing a negative-named-value like Disable. But you want to show the user Enabled when the value is false, showing an active toggle. This reverses what the toggle visual shows.

TitleFalse.en-us: Normal Toggle: true shows the active toggle

TitleIndeterminate.en-us: Default Toggle: true shows the active toggle

TitleTrue.en-us: Reverse Toggle: false shows the active toggle

Description.*: Boolean that also has a null

Description.en-us: for yes/no values (actually true/false) - shows a slider in the UI

Description.*: the fields used on all input types

Placeholder.*: The field label as shown in the edit form

Notes.*: Hidden field which tells the UI what input-type to use in a dynamic form
Note that you can also set the default value of a drop-down, just remember to use the Key of the drop-down, not the displayed text.

Placeholder.*: Default value for this field - used when this field is first filled in

Notes.*: We recommend to use this for quick hints, as it's only visible when the field is empty and will not clutter as the form is filled up.

Placeholder.*: This text will appear in the background of empty fields

Notes.en-us:
Add notes / helpful comments to aid the editor in adding his information. Note that you have a WYSIWYG for this field, but be careful to KISS.

You can also add helpful links like www.2sxc.org.

Notes.*: Configure how this field behaves in the input form.

If true (the common value) this input field is visible.

There are only a few cases, where an invisible field makes sense, but we won't tell you about these yet. It's for a future feature :).
Will permanently disable a field in the UI - so the user can see the value but not change it. You'll be able to change it using code or by prefilling it.
If this field is required. The Edit-UI won't allow saving if a required field is blank.
If enabled, will only be editable in the primary language.

TitleFalse.en-us: Auto-Translate will try to translate this and unlock the field for editing

TitleIndeterminate.en-us: Auto-Translate Default (most text fields are auto-translated, other fields not)

TitleTrue.en-us: Auto-Translate will skip this (recommended for name fields etc.)

Notes.*: See docs for ephemeral / variable / temporary fields

TitleTrue.*: Don't save value (ephemeral) - will treat this as a temporary variable in the UI

Notes.*:
Configure validation settings here to ensure that the field is ok to save or show warnings only. Read more about Field Validation in the docs.

Note that these are work-in-progress and not final yet.
These regular expressions will be used to check if the field is ok. If not valid, will prevent the form from saving. Read more about Field Validation in the docs.

These regular expressions will be used to check if the field is ok, but only show warnings if they fail. So the user can still store the data, but he'll be notified that something might be wrong. Read more about Field Validation in the docs.

OLD feature: Help text: regular expression to validate the input - the UI will not allow saving if this condition is not met - see help with tag validation for more infos. We're working on a new improved feature.
Execute custom javascript in the edit-form. Use with extreme caution. Read more on 2sxc.org/en/help?tag=edit-form-development

Notes.en-us: Formulas can change value, visibility etc. You should edit them in the edit UI using the developer mode. Use this section to manually delete or fix formulas in emergencies. See Formulas Documentation.

Title.*: Setting Visible: InEditUI: Hide if not visible or not enabled
Setting Visible: InEditUI: Hide option if it's not visible
Setting Visible: InEditUI: Show if experimental
Setting Visible: InEditUI: Show if experimental
Setting Visible: InEditUI: Hide if not visible in UI

Notes.*: Typically 0 (then only integers ergo whole numbers allowed)
Minimum value. Used if you want to ensure that a number is between two values. Leave blank if not needed.
Maximum value. Used if you want to ensure that a number is between two values. Leave blank if not needed.

Description.en-us: standard number input field with 0 or more decimals

Notes.*: If activated, the picker also enables a time-choice.

Description.en-us: Use this to manage inner content-blocks - discover more on 2sxc.org/help?tag=content-blocks
use to refer to a page, image, document, whatever

Label.en-us: Link to Url, File or Page

Description.*: use to refer to a page, image, document, whatever

Title.en-us: Links / Images expect Image Decorator Metadata

Description.*: Configure a file-library field containing folders, files and more.

EditInstructions.*: Many files, optionally in folders - just for this field. Ideal for galeries and more. Each file and folder can also have additional metadata if configured.

Description.*: Library of files, optionally with folders and file/folder metadata

Title.en-us: Link Libraries / Albums expect ImageDecorator Metadata

Notes.*: If sub folders are allowed and how deply they may be nested. Use 0 for no sub folders, 1 for 1 level only, 2 for 2 levels (like /gallery/subgallery) etc. Use a large number like 100 for practically unlimited sub folders, but not recommended for realistic use cases.

Specifies if files may be placed in the core / root container, or if the user is required to create sub folders. This would be the case if you expect multiple groups of files, but never a top-level list.

The content-type (or types) to be used for assets in this library. To use this, first create a content-type (like DownloadMetadata or MugshotMetadata) and type the name of the content type into this field. Advanced configuration is possible, discover on 2sxc.org/help?tag=adam
Enter the allowed file extensions, comma-separated. Example: "*.jpg,*.bmp,*.png,*.gif" or you can also do "jpg,png,doc" or use regex like "[0-9]{2}.*\.(jpg|png)"

Name.*: Buttons to the Side of the Input Field

Notes.*: Buttons to show directly at the input-field. Use combinations of adam, page and more. More help here.
These are the buttons you can show in the large dialog, in the more "…" button.

DropdownValues.*:
None:None
Automatic Data Asset Manager (ADAM):Adam
Page Picker:PagePicker
Image Manager:ImageManager
File Manager:FileManager

TitleTrue.*: Site Site Files Picker in Menu

Notes.*: Shows the Automatic Digital Asset Manager in the menu

TitleTrue.en-us: Enable image configuration if the file is an image 🎯

Notes.*: This is only needed if you use the old file pickers (not ADAM). Specify an existing folder and that will be the root for the file pickers. If you're unsure, best to leave it empty. More help here.
determine how server resources should be references - the default mode will create links like file:17, the other mode will use /path/file.name

DropdownValues.*:
Default (let server manage):
Let server manage the link and just use ID:id
Link directly and use url:url

Title.*: Setting Visible: InEditUI: Show only if site files are used

EditInstructions.*: This closes a field-group and doesn't have any settings.

Description.en-us: An empty field (will not store data) for Headings/Groups

EditInstructions.*: Empty fields don't get saved but are used to structure the input form.

Notes.*: If set to true, then the field group is collapsed by default.

EditInstructions.en-us: This will just show a message in the edit form.

Notes.en-us: JSONs can validate using a schema.
Many common schemas are available on SchemaStore or you can specify other URLs.
Custom schemas must adhere to the latest Draft 8 specs.

TitleFalse.en-us: Show warning if user adds comments

Csv.en-us:
Value,Title,Tooltip
strict,JSON must be valid (default),The JSON must be valid and can't be saved if it isn't.
light,Show warning on invalid JSON,The JSON should be valid, but save is still allowed if not.
none,JSON can be anything (not recommended),Allow any input, incl. text and invalid JSON.

Value,Title,Info
none,No Schema (default),"Don't use a JSON Schema"
strict,Enforce (recommended),"You can provide a real JSON Schema which will be checked and enforced."
light,Suggest,"Use a JSON Schema to help editing, but don't enforce"

Value,Title,Info
link,Link / URL,"Use a link to a Schema in the internet or on your site"
raw,Manual,"Add Schema manually as JSON below"

Description.*: String UI Definitions - only included for compatibility to old app-imports

EditInstructions.*: Strings don't have any own settings - all string settings are at the specific input-element.

Notes.*: This was an older implementation - do not use any more. It's only included so that old data will still work.

Previously the dropdown values were configured here. This was an older implementation - do not use any more. It's only included so that old data will still work. 

Please configure this field to be a string-dropdown and move the values to there.
This was an older implementation - do not use any more. It's only included so that old data will still work.

Name.*: Flush Old Values (toggle this after moving the values to the new location)

Description.*: Default single or multi-line string input

Notes.en-us: Determines how text will wrap if it's longer than the width of the input.

Csv.en-us:
Value,Title,Info ,"Standard","The same standard font as everywhere (default)" monospace,"Monospace (code-style)","Font where every character has the same width - usually Courier.

This is for code-style inputs"

Value,Title,Info,Css
,Automatic (default),"Text will wrap",normal
pre,Manual (only on new-line),"No line wrapping unless manually adding an enter",pre

EditInstructions.en-us: Allows text-input, but only for url-valid characters. Ideal to auto-generate path-parts based on other fields like the title.

Notes.*: Will let you automatically pick up a value - like the item-title - and use it to generate the initial path. Default is [Title] which would use the title-field.

Notes.en-us: This would allow path-parts with slashes inside the path - so word1/word2 would be allowed. Usually you don't want this, because in most cases you will want to have only non-slash words in this url-part.

TitleFalse.en-us: No slashes allowed in this field

Description.*: light wysiwyg-editor (recommended) - without images or advanced formating, as is usually the case in professional content-templates.
Edit text like using word with the tiny-mce rich-text editor

EditInstructions.*: Configure settings for the default Wysiwyg editor. For more advanced customizations you need to create a custom Wysiwyg WebComponent.

Notes.en-us: Determines if the wysiwyg is opened in a dialog (default behaviour in 2sxc 10).

Important: Enhanced mode allows editors to better align images / content in the post, but it changes how image alignment happens. This requires the page to also include some CSS to make it look good. See docs [TODO]

Placeholder.*: additional css file to load into the wysiwyg

Notes.en-us: The button to access the HTML source code.
The button to access advanced features such as formatting and tables.

Csv.en-us:
Value,Title,Info
,"Default (narrow)","Default is narrow, but visibly multi-line with ca. 3 lines of text"
1,"Minimum","As narrow as possible, so the user will usually not type much, and it doesn't take much screen space"
3,"Narrow","Narrow, but visibly multi-line"
5,"Medium","Medium size"
10,"Large","Large so it's clearly meant for a lot of text. Only do this if the user should write a lot"

Value,Title,Info
,"Default (inline editor)","Will put the WYSIWYG into the form and usually allow opening a larger dialog when working on a lot of content"
dialog,"Dialog only","Only show a brief preview of the HTML, then use the dialog for editing"
inline,"Inline without dialog","Place inline in form without dialog"

Value,Title,Info
,"Default","In default mode the button is disabled in the small editor, but enabled in the popup Dialog"
true,"Always Enable","Enable the button in both the small editor as well as the popup dialog"
false,"Always Disable","Disable the button in both the small editor as well as the popup dialog"

Value,Title,Info
,"Default","Disabled in the small editor, enabled in the popup Dialog"
true,"Always Enable","Always enable in all editors"
false,"Always Disable","Always disable in all editors"

Description.*: to pick a location with a map - can also store the values in separate number fields and auto-find an address based on values in the form
Configure the input for gps selection

Notes.*: An initial address to search for or better - tokens of form-fields to find an address in the map. example (spaces intended): [Address] [Zip] [City]
Old field - do not use any more. Only kept here for compatibility because old data already uses this field.

These two fields were an older way of passing on the numbers from the GPS picker to other number fields. Please don't use any more, as you can now simply use the GPS field itself using AsDynamic(...).
An optional field in the form into which the lat-coordinate would be copied automatically by this UI. Example: GPSLat
An optional field in the form into which the lat-coordinate would be copied automatically by this UI. Example: GPSLong

ListInstructions.en-us: Note that this is a Custom type, we recommend you use the String json instead.

Message.en-us: This is an older type - we recommend that you use the String implementation instead.

DropdownValues.en-us:
strict:JSON must be valid (default)
light:Show warning on invalid JSON but allow Save
none:JSON can be any text and also invalid JSON (not recommended)

Notes.en-us: JSONs can validate using a schema. This can be activated.

DropdownValues.en-us:
none:Don't use a JSON Schema (default)
strict:Enforce a JSON Schema
light:Use a JSON Schema to help editing, but don't enforce

link:Link to a Schema
raw:Add Schema manually as JSON

Notes.en-us: Many common schemas are available on SchemaStore or you can specify other URLs.
Custom schemas must adhere to the latest Draft 8 specs.
